column2: NYM, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Might as well be poison. After starting this medication, I experienced a multitude of symptoms. Although I could probably live with the headaches & flushing of the face, some symptoms I absolutely refuse to tolerate. The worst was the spiraling depression, nearly constant rage, muscle twitching, and racing heartbeat. I got more symptoms as time went by. I refuse to risk my health any further by taking this terrible medicine. I stopped taking the pills a couple of days ago, & I'm now experiencing new symptoms as my body tries to rid itself of the medicine. My doctor advised that this may happen. I'm back on the treadmill in an attempt to lower my BP without drugs. I will only consider HBP meds as a last resort & if nothing else works. I'm glad for those who have a more favorable experience with this medication. Sadly, it's not for me.

column2: alpha001, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been digonosed with Proxymal Supreventricular Tachcardia (PSVT). I was originally placed on Atenolol (25mg twice daily)before a failed catether ablation in Jan 2009, at which time I was placed on Flecainide (100mg, twice daily). The combinations of Atenolol and Flecainide lowered my blood pressure too low, and caused lightheadedness, cold hands and feet and numbness on my right hand. So, I was taken off the Atenolol and placed on Diltiazim (CARTIA 120mg, once a day).The first time I took this drug it caused burning or flushing sensation in my chest and also in my lower back--my cardiologist never told me about this. Since this is a time release capsule, I can feel when it releases in my body due to this burning sensation. Is anyone else having this sypmtom? I also have this feeling of lump in my throat when I swallow and is relieved by driking water which makes me burp or belch. This have possibly developed acid reflux, another side effects. I am taking Aciphex for the reflux, but recently discovered online that Diltiazem or any meds in the calcium channel blocker category can cause this side effect.  Because the side effects outweight the benefits, I have seen a Naturopath to minimize the side effect and improve quality of life. However, the Naturopath it's not covered by insurance. He tested me and found that my liver, stomach, and lung is not functioning properly. So, he requested to have my blood tested for numerous tests. Tests that my cardiologist or doctor should have ordered. So, I am waiting to have the test results, ER Records, along with all X-Rays, Echo, etc, compile them and take it to him. From there he will determine what type of treatment or cure to put me in. This is all herbal--so no side effects.   In addition, I met a person while walking on the treadmill who also has palpating heart. She must have had a great doctor who disgnosed her Thyroid is not working properly and she's doing great! So I will ask for TSH and T4 test also.

Was ok for a couple of days, BP was lower, however, caused gastrointestinal distress ie: gas, pain and diarrhea.
